title: Meta Privacy Policies and Employment Practices Overview
summary: Meta outlines its Equal Employment Opportunity policies, detailed data collection practices across products, and specific health data handling. The company emphasizes non-discrimination, user data usage for personalization/ads, and international data transfers while providing transparency about contact information collection from non-users.
key_points: Prohibits discrimination based on 15+ protected characteristics
Collects extensive user data including device info, location, and content interactions
Uses AI and manual review for content moderation/safety
Shares data globally across Meta companies and third parties
Provides specific health data protections under Consumer Health Privacy Policy

content_sections.heading: Equal Employment Opportunity
content_sections.content: Meta prohibits discrimination based on race, religion, gender identity, disability status and 12 other protected characteristics. Provides accommodations for disabilities/religious needs during recruitment.

content_sections.heading: Data Collection Practices
content_sections.content: Collects device info, location data, content interactions, purchase history and biometric data (via camera features). Uses data for ad targeting, product improvement, and AI training across Facebook/Instagram/Meta ecosystem.

content_sections.heading: Non-User Contact Processing
content_sections.content: Uploads and stores non-users' contact info from users' address books for friend suggestions and security purposes. Retains data based on legal requirements and safety needs.

content_sections.heading: Health Data Handling
content_sections.content: Special protections for health conditions, treatments, genetic data and precise location info related to health. Shares consumer health data with researchers, law enforcement and business partners as permitted.

content_sections.heading: International Data Transfers
content_sections.content: Transfers user data globally using EU standard clauses and adequacy decisions. Maintains servers in US, Ireland, Sweden and other locations.
